.@NC5’s @chrisconte did an outstanding job covering the rural hospital closure crisis in Tennessee in this story. We need to expand Medicaid now. Tennessee lives depend on it.

“Most healthcare experts agree that the number one reason for so many closures is the state’s failure to expand Medicaid.” I agree. http://www.newschannel5.com/news/americas-rural-hospitals-are-in-crisis …

Trump’s policies have resulted in trillion dollar deficits for the foreseeable future. How big is a trillion? To put it in perspective, I think of it in terms of time. A million seconds is 12 days, a billion seconds is 32 years, and a trillion seconds is 32,000 years. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1164194309387751429 …

.@GovBillLee, if you really want to help our rural communities, Tennessee needs to expand Medicaid.

We can’t wait for the next mass shooting to happen. These are common sense reforms that would help law enforcement keep guns out of the hands of people who are a danger to themselves and others. We need to take action now.

We’ve passed two background check bills in the House and are pushing the Senate to act. Congress should suspend its summer break, go to Washington tomorrow, and take up these votes.

Assault weapon ban, background checks for gun purchases, closure of gun show loophole, magazine capacity limits, family-driven restraining orders for those with mental health issues who also have access to guns, more mental health treatment.
Here’s what I have already voted for and would urgently vote for again:

30 killed and over 50 injured since yesterday morning. El Paso, Dayton and all the rest still won’t convince the GOP to vote for sensible gun control measures? What will? Impact on their own towns, children, spouses, parents?

My heart goes out to all in El Paso. I was there just yesterday. A vibrant community, now victimized by what appears to be a hate crime, carried out by a domestic terrorist. Gun laws must change. Other appropriate interventions are vital. It’s not just one thing. It’s all of it.
